intro: Cachrys aksekiensis, commonly known as the Akseki stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing structure. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that store water, typical of succulents adapted to arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. Cachrys aksekiensis is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, thriving in well-drained soil.
